Here's a thought ğŸ‘‰ the more intuitive your #HelpDesk is the faster customers will find what they need. Would you agree? There's an insightful article by Katarzyna Kornaga on the Deviniti blog with recommendations on how to configure a #JiraServiceManagement Portal that your customers (and agents!) will ğŸ’™ğŸ’™ğŸ’™. I heartfully recommend the article in it's entirety (look for the link in the comment ğŸ˜‰ ), but if you'd like a sneak peak, here is my digest of the featured tips: ğŸ‘‰ Step 1: Organize services clearly. Group services logically. Use headings like â€œTech Helpâ€ or â€œBillingâ€ so users can navigate intuitively. ğŸ‘‰ Step 2: Simplify request forms. Simplify the process for customers by creating straightforward request forms. Use specific headings and ask only for the information you truly need. ğŸ‘‰ Step 3: Use automation wisely. Improve response time and efficiency with smart automation. Set up automatic replies to let customers know their request is received or update them on their inquiryâ€™s status. Keep the human touch, though! A personalized approach is the key to success in business. ğŸ‘‰ Step 4: Provide helpful FAQs and knowledge bases. Support customers to find answers independently by providing easy-to-read FAQs. Make your Knowledge Base clear and accessible. Self-service will surely be appreciated not only by your customers but also by agents. ğŸ‘‰ Step 5: Get feedback and improve. Encourage customer feedback! Then, act on the feedback accordingly. This will demonstrate your commitment to making their experience seamless and enjoyable. Did I miss anything? Let me know if you would add something to the list ğŸ‘‡. #jira #customerportal #serviceportal #jsm #servicemanagement

Let's forge ğŸ› ï¸ an awesome #ACE together! Have you heard of #Forge, Atlassian's development platform for building secure, reliable and scalable apps for #Jira and #Confluence #Cloud? ğŸ‘‰ Marta JarzÄ™bska ğŸ‘ˆ Software Engineer at Atlassian, will be speaking about â€œWhat is Forge, and how can it empower Jira?â€ at our upcoming #AtlassianCommunityEvent in #GdaÅ„sk in just a little more than a week. But, wait there's more! â­ Adam StÄ™pieÅ„ from Deviniti will dive into â€œRequest management with Atlassian; not bad, but can we do better?â€ â­ Ed Gaile from Appfire will share insights on â€œProviding context for context switching - learn how to navigate the complexities of team workflows seamlessly." â­ Fun Man Andy from Tempo Software will be presenting â€œUnleash the Beast: turning Frogs into Princes - a customer success storyâ€ I will be making sure we don't run out of ğŸ• & ğŸ» . ğŸ“Check out the full agenda & register to join us at the #Atlassian office in GdaÅ„sk ğŸ‘‰ https://shorturl.at/CCR7T ğŸ“… July 15th 5:00-8:00 PM CET âœ‰ï¸ RSVP Incidentally, when looking for an engineering & GdaÅ„sk themed image to illustrate this post with I thought of the nearby shipyard. But what commonalities (if any) do a forge and a crane share? Here's some Thursday-food-for-thought on this topic from #ChatGPT: 1. #Transformation and #Creation: Both a forge and a crane are tools used to transform raw materials into something useful and valuable. 2. #Power and #Strength: They symbolize power and strength. A forge harnesses the power of heat, a crane uses mechanical strength. 3. #Precision and #Skill: Both require precision and skill to operate effectively. 4. #Enabling #Construction: They are essential tools in the construction and manufacturing industries. A forge is critical in producing tools and parts, while a crane is vital for assembling large structures. So now you know ğŸ˜‰. Did you know that one of the most famous dishes from #Gdansk is "Matjes herring" ğŸŸ? This dish features young, mild herring that is typically marinated and served in various preparations. Matjes herring is celebrated for its delicate flavor and is often accompanied by onions, sour cream, apples, and other local ingredients. As it happens, I know someone who will soon be getting a taste of this delicacy! ğŸŒŸ Meet Ed Gaile, Sr. Sales Solution Architect & BBQ Connoisseur ğŸ¥©at Appfire and tune into his talk at our upcoming #AtlassianCommunityEvent!
